template.name: Jenkins by HTTP
template.description:
Get Jenkins metrics by HTTP agent. Metrics are collected by requests to Metrics API. Install Metrics plugin and configure access to the Metrics Servlet by issuing API key. Don't forget to change macros {$JENKINS.URL}, {$JENKINS.USER}, {$JENKINS.API.TOKEN}, {$JENKINS.API.KEY}.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: Jenkins: File descriptor ratio
item.description: The ratio of used to total file descriptors

trigger.name: Jenkins: Current number of used files is too high
trigger.event_name: Jenkins: Current number of used files is too high (over {$JENKINS.FILE_DESCRIPTORS.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)

item.name: Jenkins: Disk space check
item.description: Returns FAIL if any of the Jenkins disk space monitors are reporting the disk space as less than the configured threshold.

item.name: Jenkins: Disk space check message
item.description: The message will reference the first node which fails this check. There may be other nodes that fail the check, but this health check is designed to fail fast.

item.name: Jenkins: Executors count
item.description: The number of executors available to Jenkins. This is corresponds to the sum of all the executors of all the on-line nodes.

item.name: Jenkins: Executors free
item.description: The number of executors available to Jenkins that are not currently in use.

item.name: Jenkins: Executors in use
item.description: The number of executors available to Jenkins that are currently in use.

item.name: Jenkins: Get gauges
item.description: Raw items for gauges metrics.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP active requests, rate
item.description: The number of currently active requests against the Jenkins master Web UI.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 400, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/400 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 201, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/201 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 403, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/403 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 404, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/404 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 304, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/304 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 204, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/204 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 200, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/200 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response other, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a non-informational status code that is not in the list: HTTP/200, HTTP/201, HTTP/204, HTTP/304, HTTP/400, HTTP/403, HTTP/404, HTTP/500, or HTTP/503.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP requests, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is receiving requests.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP requests, median
item.description: The time spent generating the corresponding responses.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP requests, p95
item.description: The time spent generating the corresponding responses.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 500, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/500 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: HTTP response 503, rate
item.description: The rate at which the Jenkins master Web UI is responding to requests with a HTTP/503 status code.

item.name: Jenkins: Job blocked duration, median
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job blocked duration, p95
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job blocked, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs in the build queue enter the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job blocked, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs in the build queue enter the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job buildable duration, median
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend in the buildable state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job buildable duration, p95
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend in the buildable state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job buildable, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs in the build queue enter the buildable state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job buildable, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs in the build queue enter the buildable state.

item.name: Jenkins: Job building duration, median
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend building.

item.name: Jenkins: Job building duration, p95
item.description: The amount of time which jobs spend building.

item.name: Jenkins: Job building, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are built.

item.name: Jenkins: Job building, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are built.

item.name: Jenkins: Jobs count
item.description: The number of jobs in Jenkins.

item.name: Jenkins: Job queuing duration, median
item.description: The total time which jobs spend in the build queue.

item.name: Jenkins: Job queuing duration, p95
item.description: The total time which jobs spend in the build queue.

item.name: Jenkins: Job queuing, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are queued.

item.name: Jenkins: Job queuing, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are queued.

item.name: Jenkins: Job scheduled, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are scheduled. If a job is already in the queue and an identical request for scheduling the job is received then Jenkins will coalesce the two requests. This metric gives a reasonably pure measure of the load requirements of the Jenkins master as it is unaffected by the number of executors available to the system.

item.name: Jenkins: Jobs scheduled, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are scheduled. If a job is already in the queue and an identical request for scheduling the job is received then Jenkins will coalesce the two requests. This metric gives a reasonably pure measure of the load requirements of the Jenkins master as it is unaffected by the number of executors available to the system.

item.name: Jenkins: Job total duration, median
item.description: The total time which jobs spend from entering the build queue to completing building.

item.name: Jenkins: Job total duration, p95
item.description: The total time which jobs spend from entering the build queue to completing building.

item.name: Jenkins: Job total, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are queued.

item.name: Jenkins: Job total, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs are queued.

item.name: Jenkins: Job waiting duration, median
item.description: The total amount of time that jobs spend in their quiet period.

item.name: Jenkins: Job waiting duration, p95
item.description: The total amount of time that jobs spend in their quiet period.

item.name: Jenkins: Job waiting, m1 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs enter the quiet period.

item.name: Jenkins: Job waiting, m5 rate
item.description: The rate at which jobs enter the quiet period.

item.name: Jenkins: Get meters
item.description: Raw items for meters metrics.

item.name: Jenkins: Nodes count
item.description: The number of build nodes available to Jenkins, both on-line and off-line.

item.name: Jenkins: Nodes offline
item.description: The number of build nodes available to Jenkins but currently off-line.

item.name: Jenkins: Nodes online
item.description: The number of build nodes available to Jenkins and currently on-line.

trigger.name: Jenkins: Service has no online nodes

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins check
item.description: Returns FAIL if any of the Jenkins plugins failed to start.

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins active
item.description: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that started successfully.

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins failed
item.description: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that failed to start. A value other than 0 is typically indicative of a potential issue within the Jenkins installation that will either be solved by explicitly disabling the plugin(s) or by resolving the plugin dependency issues.

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins inactive
item.description: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that are not currently enabled.

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins check message
item.description: The message of plugins health check.

item.name: Jenkins: Plugins with update
item.description: The number of plugins in the Jenkins instance that have an newer version reported as available in the current Jenkins update center metadata held by Jenkins. This value is not indicative of an issue with Jenkins but high values can be used as a trigger to review the plugins with updates with a view to seeing whether those updates potentially contain fixes for issues that could be affecting your Jenkins instance.

item.name: Jenkins: Projects count
item.description: The number of projects.

item.name: Jenkins: Build queue, blocked
item.description: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Build queue, buildable
item.description: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Build queue, pending
item.description: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: Build queue, size
item.description: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue.

item.name: Jenkins: Build queue, stuck
item.description: The number of jobs that are in the Jenkins build queue and currently in the blocked state.

item.name: Jenkins: CPU Load
item.description: The system load on the Jenkins master as reported by the JVM's Operating System JMX bean. The calculation of system load is operating system dependent. Typically this is the sum of the number of processes that are currently running plus the number that are waiting to run. This is typically comparable against the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Jenkins: Uptime
item.description: The number of seconds since the Jenkins master JVM started.

item.name: Jenkins: Temporary space check
item.description: Returns FAIL if any of the Jenkins temporary space monitors are reporting the temporary space as less than the configured threshold.

item.name: Jenkins: Temporary space check message
item.description: The message will reference the first node which fails this check. There may be other nodes that fail the check, but this health check is designed to fail fast.

item.name: Jenkins: Thread deadlock check
item.description: Returns FAIL if there are any deadlocked threads in the Jenkins master JVM.

item.name: Jenkins: Thread deadlock check message
item.description: The message of thread deadlock health check.

item.name: Jenkins: Get timers
item.description: Raw items for timers metrics.

item.name: Jenkins: Version
item.description: Version of Jenkins server.

trigger.expression: last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.version,#1)<>last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.version,#2) and length(last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.version))>0
trigger.name: Jenkins: Version has changed
trigger.description: The Jenkins version has changed. Perform Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Available physical memory
item_prototype.description: The total physical memory of the system, available bytes.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Available swap space
item_prototype.description: Available swap space in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Clock difference
item_prototype.description: The clock difference between the master and nodes.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Available disk space
item_prototype.description: The available disk space of $JENKINS_HOME on agent.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Get computer
item_prototype.description: Raw data for a computer.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Idle
item_prototype.description: Returns true if all the executors of this computer are idle.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Executors
item_prototype.description: The maximum number of concurrent builds that Jenkins may perform on this node.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Offline cause reason
item_prototype.description: If the computer was offline (either temporarily or not), will return the cause as a string (without user info). Empty string if the system was put offline without given a cause.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Response time average
item_prototype.description: The round trip network response time from the master to the agent

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: State
item_prototype.description: Represents the actual online/offline state. Node description: {#DESCRIPTION}

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Temporarily offline
item_prototype.description: Returns true if this node is marked temporarily offline.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Available temp space
item_prototype.description: The available disk space of the temporary directory. Java tools and tests/builds often create files in the temporary directory, and may not function properly if there's no available space.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Total physical memory
item_prototype.description: Total physical memory of the system, in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Total swap space
item_prototype.description: Total number of swap space in bytes.

dependency.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Node is temporarily offline
Jenkins: Service has no online nodes

trigger_prototype.name: Jenkins: Computer [{#DISPLAY_NAME}]: Node is temporarily offline
trigger_prototype.description: Node is temporarily Offline with reason: {{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}.regsub("(.*)",\1)}

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Health score
Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Get job
item_prototype.description: Raw data for a job.

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Build duration
item_prototype.description: Build duration (in seconds).

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Build number
item_prototype.description: Details: {#URL}/lastBuild/

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Failed Build duration
item_prototype.description: Build duration (in seconds).

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Failed Build number
item_prototype.description: Details: {#URL}/lastFailedBuild/

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Failed Build timestamp
Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Successful Build duration
item_prototype.description: Build duration (in seconds).

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Successful Build number
item_prototype.description: Details: {#URL}/lastSuccessfulBuild/

item_prototype.name: Jenkins job [{#NAME}]: Last Successful Build timestamp

macro.description: API key to access Metrics Servlet
API token for HTTP BASIC authentication.
Maximum percentage of file descriptors usage alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Minimum job's health score (for trigger expression).

trigger.expression: last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.disk_space)=0 and length(last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.disk_space.message))>0
trigger.name: Jenkins: Disk space is too low
trigger.description: Jenkins disk space monitors are reporting the disk space as less than the configured threshold. The message will reference the first node which fails this check. Health check message: {{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}.regsub("(.*)",\1)}

trigger.expression: last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.plugins)=0 and length(last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.plugins.message))>0
trigger.name: Jenkins: One or more Jenkins plugins failed to start
trigger.description: A failure is typically indicative of a potential issue within the Jenkins installation that will either be solved by explicitly disabling the failing plugin(s) or by resolving the corresponding plugin dependency issues. Health check message: {{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}.regsub("(.*)",\1)}

trigger.expression: last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.temporary_space)=0 and length(last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.temporary_space.message))>0
trigger.name: Jenkins: Temporary space is too low
trigger.description: Jenkins temporary space monitors are reporting the temporary space as less than the configured threshold. The message will reference the first node which fails this check. Health check message: {{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}.regsub("(.*)",\1)}

trigger.expression: last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.thread_deadlock)=0 and length(last(/Jenkins by HTTP/jenkins.thread_deadlock.message))>0
trigger.name: Jenkins: There are deadlocked threads in Jenkins master JVM
trigger.description: There are any deadlocked threads in the Jenkins master JVM. Health check message: {{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}.regsub('(.*)',\1)}
